```{r,include=FALSE}
theme_clean <- function() {
  theme_minimal(base_family = "News Cycle") +
    theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
          plot.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
          axis.title = element_text(face = "bold"),
          strip.text = element_text(face = "bold", size = rel(1), hjust = 0),
          strip.background = element_rect(fill = "grey80", color = NA),
          legend.title = element_text(face = "bold"))
}


theme_publish <- function(base_size = 12, base_family = "",
                          base_line_size = 0.25, ...) {
  half_line <- base_size / 2
  small_rel <- 0.8
  small_size <- small_rel * base_size
  
  # TODO: replace size with linewidth in `element_rect()`
  theme_bw(base_size = base_size, base_family = base_family, ...) %+replace%
    theme(
      rect = element_rect(fill = "transparent", colour = NA, color = NA,
                          size = 0, linetype = 0),
      text = element_text(family = base_family, face = "plain",
                          colour = "black", size = base_size, hjust = 0.5,
                          vjust = 0.5, angle = 0, lineheight = 0.9,
                          margin = ggplot2::margin(), debug = F),
      
      axis.text = element_text(size = small_size),
      axis.text.x = element_text(margin = ggplot2::margin(t = small_size/4),
                                 vjust = 1),
      axis.text.y = element_text(margin = ggplot2::margin(r = small_size/4), 
                                 hjust = 1),
      axis.title.x = element_text(margin = ggplot2::margin(t = small_size,
                                                           b = small_size)),
      axis.title.y = element_text(angle = 90,
                                  margin = ggplot2::margin(r = small_size,
                                                           l = small_size/4)),
      axis.ticks = element_line(colour = "black", size = base_line_size),
      axis.ticks.length = unit(0.25, 'lines'),
      
      axis.line = element_line(colour = "black", size = base_line_size),
      axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "black", size = base_line_size), 
      axis.line.y = element_line(colour = "black", size = base_line_size), 
      
      legend.spacing = unit(base_size/4, "pt"),
      legend.key = element_blank(),
      legend.key.size = unit(1 * base_size, "pt"),
      legend.key.width = unit(1.5 * base_size, 'pt'),
      legend.text = element_text(size = rel(small_rel)),
      legend.title = element_text(size = rel(small_rel), face = 'bold'),
      legend.position = 'bottom',
      legend.box = 'horizontal',
      
      panel.spacing = unit(1, "lines"),
      panel.background = element_blank(),
      panel.border = element_blank(), 
      # panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
      # panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
      # 
      strip.text = element_text(size = base_size),
      strip.background = element_rect(fill = NA, colour = "black",
                                      size = 0.125),
      strip.text.x = element_text(face = 'bold', hjust = 0,
                                  margin = ggplot2::margin(b = small_size/2,
                                                           t = small_size/4)),
      strip.text.y = element_text(angle = -90, face = 'bold',
                                  margin = ggplot2::margin(l = small_size/2,
                                                           r = small_size/4)),
      
      plot.margin = unit(c(5,5,0,0), "pt"),
      plot.background = element_blank(),
      plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = 1.2 * base_size, 
                                margin = ggplot2::margin(b = half_line),
                                hjust = 0)
    )
}
```

# Data 
```{r,include=FALSE}
C_Stocks_Collated_DF<-read.csv("final_collated_data/collated_kelp_biomass_density_df.csv")

Biomass_final_df <- read.csv("processed_data/SST_PAR_of_Biomass_Sites.csv")
names(Biomass_final_df) <-c("ID","Site.Name","Year","APA.Citation","Mean_PAR_BioOracle","Mean_SST_BioOracle")

C_Stocks_Collated_DF <- left_join(C_Stocks_Collated_DF,Biomass_final_df,by=c("Site.Name","Year","APA.Citation"))

```

```{r,results = FALSE}
C_stock_model_data <- data.frame(
  ocean= C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Coast, #Arctic, Atlantic, Pacific
  canopy_type=as.character(C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Canopy_Type),# surface vs subsurface
  site = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Site.Name,  # Site identifier
  year = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Year,
  month = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Month,
  season = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Season,
  decade= C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Decade,
  depth_bin = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Depth,
  ocean_temperature = as.numeric(C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Mean_SST_BioOracle),
  PAR = as.numeric(C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Mean_PAR_BioOracle),
  taxa = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Taxa, #species
  latitude=as.numeric(C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Latitude),
  effect = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Standing.Stock.Corg.MgHa.1,  # Site or study level mean
  sd = C_Stocks_Collated_DF$Standing.Stock.Corg.MgHa.1.SD,
  source=C_Stocks_Collated_DF$APA.Citation)%>% # Site or study level sd on the mean 
  mutate(observation_id = 1:n(), 
         # sd=ifelse(sd==0,NA,sd))%>%
          sd=ifelse(is.na(sd)==TRUE,0,sd))%>%
    filter(taxa == "A. clathratum / N. fimbriatum"|
             taxa == "Macrocystis pyrifera" |
             taxa == "Nereocystis luetkeana" |
             taxa == "Saccharina latissima" |
             taxa == "Pleurophycus gardneri" |
             taxa == "Pterygophora californica" |
             taxa == "Hedophyllum nigripes"|
             taxa=="Laminaria digitata"|
             taxa == "L. digitata / H. nigripes"|
             taxa == "Laminaria solidungula"|
             # taxa == "Laminaria setchellii" |
            #Only one record available
             # Taxa == "Eisenia arborea"| ## Eisenia data is too hot for Canada
             taxa == "Costaria costata")%>%
             # taxa =="Cymathaere triplicata")
    filter(season!="Fall")%>%
  mutate(taxa=ifelse(taxa=="Hedophyllum nigripes" |taxa=="Laminaria digitata","L. digitata / H. nigripes",taxa))%>%
  mutate(ocean_temperature=ifelse(is.na(ocean_temperature)==TRUE & site=="Zaikof Point", 8.030507,ocean_temperature))%>%
  mutate(ocean_temperature= ifelse(is.na(ocean_temperature)==TRUE & site=="Evans Island",7.626471,ocean_temperature))%>%
  mutate(ocean_temperature=ifelse(is.na(ocean_temperature)==TRUE, 10.5,ocean_temperature))%>%
  mutate(PAR=ifelse(is.na(PAR)==TRUE & site=="Zaikof Point",28.885000,PAR))%>%
  mutate(PAR=ifelse(is.na(ocean_temperature)==TRUE & site=="Evans Island",27.240999,PAR))%>%
  mutate(PAR=ifelse((PAR)==TRUE,31.5,PAR))
                                                                 
                                  
#splitting the data by species
C_stock_model_data_sppsplit <-C_stock_model_data%>%
  dplyr::group_by(taxa)

C_stock_model_data_sppsplit<-group_split(C_stock_model_data_sppsplit)

```

# Setting up the priors
```{r}
#for intercept only models
priors_IO<- c(prior(student_t(3,0,9), class = Intercept),
             prior(student_t(3,0,9), class = sigma))


#for mixed effects models
priors_FE<- c(prior(student_t(3,0,9), class = Intercept),
              prior(student_t(3,0,9),class=b),
              prior(student_t(3,0,9), class = sigma))


load(file="Rdata/Carbon_Stock_BRMs.RData")

```

# C STANDING STOCK MODELS - 
## Macrocystis pyrifera
```{r,results = FALSE}
Mpyr_C_stock_df <- C_stock_model_data_sppsplit[[5]]

Mpyr_C_stock_test_df<-Mpyr_C_stock_df%>%
  # select(ocean,sd,ocean_temperature)%>%
  # mutate(sd=as.integer(sd),ocean_temperature=as.integer(ocean_temperature))
  select(ocean,sd,ocean_temperature)%>%
  mutate(sd=as.integer(sd))


Mpyr_C_stock_test_df<-unique(Mpyr_C_stock_test_df)
Mpyr_C_stock_test_df$site <- NA
Mpyr_C_stock_test_df$source <- NA
Mpyr_C_stock_test_df$year <- NA
# 
Mpyr.stock.1 <- brm(data = Mpyr_C_stock_df,
                  family= gaussian,
                  formula = effect | resp_se(`sd`,sigma = TRUE) ~ ocean_temperature + (1 | year) + (1 |site),
                  prior = priors_FE,
                  control = list(
                    adapt_delta = .99,
                    max_treedepth = 15),
                  sample_prior = TRUE,
                  iter=5000, warmup=2500, chains = 3)

Mpyr.stock.2 <- brm(data = Mpyr_C_stock_df,
                  family= gaussian,
                  formula = effect | resp_se(`sd`,sigma = TRUE) ~  (1 | year) + (1 |site),
                  prior = priors_IO,
                  control = list(
                    adapt_delta = .99,
                    max_treedepth = 15),
                  sample_prior = TRUE,
                  iter=5000, warmup=2500, chains = 3)
```

```{r}
loo(Mpyr.stock.1,Mpyr.stock.2)

Mpyr.stock.final <- Mpyr.stock.2

#save model output object
saveRDS(Mpyr.stock.final, file="final_brms/Mpy_stock_final.rds")


performance::r2(Mpyr.stock.final)

summary(Mpyr.stock.final)

# conditional_effects(Mpyr.stock.final)
plot(Mpyr.stock.final, ask = FALSE)

# Comparing priors to posteriors
Mpyr_priors <- prior_draws(Mpyr.stock.final)
Mpyr_post<- as.data.frame(Mpyr.stock.final)

ggplot() +
  geom_density(data = Mpyr_priors, aes(x = Intercept)) +
  geom_density(data = Mpyr_post, aes(x = b_Intercept), color = "blue") +
  labs(title = "Prior Distribution vs. Posterior Distribution") +
  xlim(-30,  30) +
  theme_classic()

# Comparing prior predictive check plots - for model accuracy
pp_check(Mpyr.stock.final)

#grand means
Mpyr.epred <- Mpyr.stock.final %>%
  epred_draws(newdata = Mpyr_C_stock_test_df,
              re_formula = NA)

avg_predictions(model = Mpyr.stock.final,by="ocean",newdata=Mpyr_C_stock_df,conf_level = 0.95)
# Mpyr.stock.final %>% 
#   emmeans(~ 1,
#           # at = list(ocean = "Pacific"),
#           epred = TRUE, re_formula = NA) %>% 
#   # contrast(method = "revpairwise") %>% 
#   gather_emmeans_draws()%>%
#   mean_hdci()

ggplot(Mpyr.epred, aes(x = .epred,y=ocean,fill=ocean)) +
  stat_halfeye() +
  scale_fill_okabe_ito() +
  labs(x = "Predicted C Stock (Mg C Ha-1)", y = NULL,
       # fill = "Ocean",
       subtitle = "Macrocystis pyrifera - Posterior predictions") +
  theme_clean() +
```
